edu.asu.ying.mapreduce.io

Class DelimitedTextSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.asu.ying.mapreduce.io.DelimitedTextSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ElementSource

    public class DelimitedTextSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements ElementSource
    Provides element pairs from a text source. Elements are separated by an element delimiter, and key->value pairs are separated by a pair delimiter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DelimitedTextSource(java.io.InputStream input, ElementSink nextSink, char elementDelimiter, char pairDelimiter)
      Open the source on an input and/or output stream.

      Retrieve at most maxCount elements from the underlying data source and send them to the sink stack.

      Retrieve at most maxCount elements from the underlying data source and send them to the sink stack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DelimitedTextSource

        public DelimitedTextSource(java.io.InputStream input,
                   ElementSink nextSink,
                   char elementDelimiter,
                   char pairDelimiter)
        Open the source on an input and/or output stream. Elements are delimited by elementDelimiter, and key->value pairs within each element are delimited by pairDelimiter.

        E.g. if elementDelimiter is \n and pairDelimiter is , then the following text: 

         Apples,Red
 Lemons,Yellow
        would produce the following elements: 
         ["Apples"->"Red", "Lemons"->"Yellow"]
        Parameters:
        input - the text input stream.
        elementDelimiter - the delimiter that separates one key->value pair from another.
        pairDelimiter - the delimiter that separates the key from the value in each element.

    • Method Detail

        public ElementSink getNextSink()
        Returns the stack of element sinks that will receieve elements produced by this element source.
        Specified by:
        getNextSink in interface ElementSource

      • readNextElement

        public void readNextElement()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Retrieve an Element from the underlying data source and send it to the sink stack.
        Specified by:
        readNextElement in interface ElementSource
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.

      • readNextElement

        public void readNextElement(int timeout)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Retrieve an Element from the underlying data source and send it to the sink stack.
        Specified by:
        readNextElement in interface ElementSource
        Parameters:
        timeout - if > 0, the call will block for timeout ms before throwing NoSuchElementException. If <= 0, the call will block until an element is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available, timeout ms is exceeded before any elements become available, or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.

      • readNextElements

        public void readNextElements(int maxCount)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Retrieve at most maxCount elements from the underlying data source and send them to the sink stack.
        Specified by:
        readNextElements in interface ElementSource
        Parameters:
        maxCount - maximum number of elements to read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.

      • readNextElements

        public void readNextElements(int maxCount,
                    int timeout)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Retrieve at most maxCount elements from the underlying data source and send them to the sink stack.
        Specified by:
        readNextElements in interface ElementSource
        Parameters:
        maxCount - maximum number of elements to read.
        timeout - if > 0, the call will block for timeout ms before throwing NoSuchElementException. If <= 0, the call will block until an element is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available, timeout ms is exceeded before any elements become available, or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.
